name: Basic: ls recurse
description: List the contents of the home directory recursively using the `ls` command. Optimal solution without `cd` is preferred but any solution that works is acceptable.

name: Basic: wildcard and redirect
description: Print the contents of all the files in the current directory using a single command. Write the `stdout` to a file named `out.txt` and print it to the terminal at the same time.

name: Intermediate: 5 biggest data hogs
description: Run `du` and get the 5 biggest data hogs in the user's home directory using piping, `sort` and `head`.

name: Intermediate: find and replace
description: Replace all occurrences of `foo` with `bar` in `foo.txt` using `sed`.

name: Advanced: word count
description: Count the number of words in `file.txt` *without* using `wc`. You can use any other command you like. Sort in decreasing order.
